TITLE: Mark Zuckerberg’s advice for young people: Focus more on building relationships than being 'objective focused'
SUMMARY: On a March episode of Lex Fridman's podcast, the Meta CEO explained why he thinks college students should be selective about who they hang out with.

TITLE: Biden warns Xi of global backlash if China helps Russia's attack on Ukraine
SUMMARY: Biden and Chinese Pres. Xi Jinping agreed to work for peace in Ukraine. But China refused to say Russia was responsible for its brutal invasion of the country.

TITLE: Russia backs down on demands in Iran nuclear deal talks, making revival of 2015 pact imminent
SUMMARY: A return to the 2015 deal would see the return of Iranian oil to the market at a time when crude prices have hit their highest levels in more than a decade.

TITLE: Cramer’s week ahead: ‘I’m begging you’ to sell stocks of unprofitable companies
SUMMARY: Next week could be an opportunity for investors to shuffle holdings around, the "Mad Money" host said Friday.

TITLE: Russia central bank warns of 'large-scale structural transformation' for economy, holds rates at 20%
SUMMARY: The Central Bank of Russia on Friday held its monetary policy steady and maintained its key interest rate at 20%.

TITLE: Dow rallies more than 270 points Friday as stocks post their best week since 2020
SUMMARY: Stocks kept climbing Friday after a three-day surge that put the major averages on pace for their biggest weekly gains in more than a year.

TITLE: The 4 types of vacations that may be hard to book in 2022
SUMMARY: After two years of vacation plans being halted by Covid-19, travelers are beginning to regain their confidence and are booking holidays up to a year in advance.

TITLE: This country has been named the world’s happiest for the fifth year in a row
SUMMARY: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year in a row, according to an annual report.

TITLE: Investors come off a strong week looking for more gains now that they have some clarity from the Fed
SUMMARY: With the Fed's first rate hike out of the way, market pros are now debating whether the market can continue the upswing it started in the past week.

TITLE: Over 400 companies have withdrawn from Russia. But some Western brands are locked in
SUMMARY: For some Western brands like Burger King, Subway and Marks & Spencer, exiting the Russian market is easier said than done.

TITLE: U.S. officials continue to press Russia for access to WNBA star Brittney Griner
SUMMARY: A person close to the situation confirmed to NBC News that Griner was "OK" and that her Russian legal team has met with her.

TITLE: European markets close higher, notch best weekly gain since 2020 amid Russia-Ukraine talks
SUMMARY: European markets closed higher on Friday, notching their best weekly gain since 2020, as investors tracked negotiations between Russia and Ukraine.

TITLE: St. Louis Fed's Bullard says the central bank should raise rates above 3% this year
SUMMARY: Bullard said in a statement that he would like to see the central bank's benchmark interest rate boosted above 3% from the near-0% level where it had stood.

TITLE: Berkshire Hathaway shares topped $500,000 each—here's why Warren Buffett says he'll never split the stock
SUMMARY: Warren Buffett has argued that the high price of Berkshire's Class A stock has been a boon to shareholders over the years.

TITLE: Here's how retail investors are hedging against the market volatility
SUMMARY: Investors are feeling bearish as the market volatility continues. Here are some ways retail traders are safeguarding their portfolios.

TITLE: UK Covid cases are back on the rise as government scraps travel restrictions
SUMMARY: U.K. Covid-19 cases are rising once again, according to the latest figures from the ONS, just as the government lifts remaining travel restrictions.

TITLE: Covid pushed nearly 5 million more in Southeast Asia into extreme poverty, says Asian Development Bank
SUMMARY: Covid-19 pushed 4.7 million people in Southeast Asia into extreme poverty last year and erased 9.3 million jobs, the Asian Development Bank said.

TITLE: Portraits of war: See how the attack on Ukraine has affected its people
SUMMARY: Since Russia invaded Ukraine last month, more than 2.5 million people have been displaced.

TITLE: Maserati unveils all-electric plan, starting with a new 1,200-horsepower GranTurismo
SUMMARY: Maserati plans to offer electric versions of its entire lineup by 2025, starting next year with a new GranTurismo EV featuring more than 1,200 horsepower.

TITLE: Here's how Covid-19 transitions from a pandemic to endemic
Apple's new Mac Studio and Studio Display are great if you have $3,600, but most people should get a Mac Mini
SUMMARY: The Mac Studio is for people who want the fastest Mac available and don't care how much it costs.

TITLE: Putin's next target may be Eastern Europe's Moldova, analysts warn
SUMMARY: As Russia faces staunch and seemingly unexpected resistance on the ground in Ukraine, analysts warn Putin may be considering his next target: Moldova.

TITLE: Here's what Chinese state media is saying ahead of Xi's call with Biden
SUMMARY: While Chinese state media have tacked away from primarily pro-Russian coverage of the war with Ukraine, one of the consistent messages remains: Blame the U.S.

TITLE: Reduce speed limits and car-free Sundays: The IEA has a 10-point plan to cut oil use
SUMMARY: Recommendations come at a time when oil markets are facing significant uncertainty following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: China's Xpeng hikes price of cars following Tesla and other EV makers as raw material costs rise
SUMMARY: Xpeng said from Mar. 21, price increases on its electric vehicles will range from 10,100 yuan ($1,587) to 20,000 yuan ($3,143) before subsidies.

TITLE: Nickel falls 12% to hit limit down again on London Metal Exchange
SUMMARY: The benchmark three-month nickel contract fell 12% on Friday morning to hit a new trading limit, as heavy selling continued on international metal markets.

TITLE: Porsche increases EV targets, confirms 911 hybrid sports car
SUMMARY: Porsche on Friday announced it expects 80% of its global sales to be all-electric vehicles by 2030.

TITLE: Investor behavior in Europe is mirroring the market's worst crises, new research shows
SUMMARY: European fund flow patterns so far this year are emulating historical crisis periods for markets, according to a new report from Refinitiv.

TITLE: Jim Cramer says investors should buy these 11 recently boosted dividend stocks
SUMMARY: "You want bountiful dividends that are also safe," the "Mad Money" host said Thursday.

TITLE: Why Russian people need tech companies to stay, not withdraw: It's terrifying 'how dark that place could become'
SUMMARY: Though some Ukrainian officials have called for tech platforms to cut ties with Russia, internet freedom advocates say that could have unintended consequences.
